meta.title: PokeRogue
meta.description: Experience PokeRogue, where Pokémon meets roguelite gameplay. Battle trainers, collect items, and explore unique biomes for endless fun!

hero.title: PokeRogue
hero.subTitle: Dive into PokeRogue, a thrilling blend of the Pokémon universe and roguelite mechanics. Battle through diverse biomes, collect powerful items, and face iconic trainers for a unique gaming experience that keeps you returning for more!

features.title: Key Features
features.subTitle: Designed to enhance your gaming experience with thrilling and engaging gameplay.

items.title: Unique Gameplay Loop
items.description: PokeRogue blends Pokémon with roguelike mechanics, featuring a 'play, die, grow, repeat' gameplay loop that keeps each run exciting.

items.title: Starter Pokémon Selection
items.description: Choose starter Pokémon from all generations, each assigned a value for balanced team composition, enhancing strategy and gameplay.

items.title: 10-Battle Gauntlets
items.description: Engage in 10 consecutive battles per level, including trainer encounters and challenges against iconic gym leaders, for a test of skill.

items.title: Strategic Healing and Capturing
items.description: Items are essential for healing and capturing Pokémon, as there are no Pokémon Centers in the game, adding a layer of strategy.

items.title: Rewarding Gym Leader Battles
items.description: Defeating gym leaders grants tickets for egg gacha machines, introducing new Pokémon and powerful egg moves to enhance your team.

items.title: Fan-Made Experience
items.description: PokeRogue is a non-profit, unofficial fan-made game, celebrating the Pokémon spirit without any affiliation to Game Freak or Nintendo.

howToPlay.title: How to Play PokeRogue?
howToPlay.subTitle: Jump right into your Pokémon adventure with these simple steps:

items.text: Meta Progression: Each run builds on previous achievements, making future runs more powerful and engaging.
Unlock Starter Pokémon: As you catch various Pokémon, they become available as potential starters for future runs.
Explore Biomes: Catch Pokémon from all generations by exploring diverse biomes filled with surprises.
Egg Gacha: Redeem vouchers in the Egg Gacha to hatch eggs, which can provide powerful starting egg moves.
Transfer Traits: Caught or hatched Pokémon transfer beneficial traits to corresponding starters for future runs.
Obtain Starter-Specific Candies: Gain candies as you catch and use your starters, offering various enhancements.
Strategic Battles: Choose moves wisely during battles to defeat enemy Pokémon and gain experience.
Item Collection: Collect items dropped by defeated Pokémon or found in the environment, stacking benefits for your team.
Team Management: Build a diverse team and switch between Pokémon strategically during battles.
Face Challenges: Overcome increasingly difficult trainers and boss Pokémon as you progress through the game.
Unique Runs: Each run is unique, with overall progress persisting, allowing you to learn, unlock new starters, and improve your Pokémon.

items.question: What is PokeRogue?
items.answer: PokeRogue is a fan-made Pokémon game combining traditional Pokémon gameplay with roguelike mechanics, focusing on strategic battles and high-stakes challenges.

items.question: How does PokeRogue differ from traditional Pokémon games?
items.answer: PokeRogue features permadeath, no Pokémon Centers, consecutive battle mechanics, and a unique starter selection system, emphasizing IVs and new collection methods.

items.question: How do you start a game in PokeRogue?
items.answer: Select from various starter Pokémon, with each having a value from 1-9. Players can choose multiple starters as long as their total value does not exceed 10.

items.question: Are there gyms in PokeRogue?
items.answer: While there are no traditional gyms, players encounter gym leaders as part of the challenging 10-battle gauntlets throughout the game.

items.question: How do you heal Pokémon in PokeRogue?
items.answer: Healing relies on items obtained after battles or purchased with in-game currency. All Pokémon are fully healed and revived after completing a 10-battle gauntlet.
